author: Special Correspondent
text:
A few thousand beedi workers took out a massive rally in Palayamkottai on Thursday in protest against the Union Government’s policies, which are “annihilating” the beedi industry though it was the livelihood for over 10 lakh people.

The protestors said the Centre’s instruction on compulsorily printing of cancer warning signs on the beedi labels and bundles should be withdrawn as it would seriously affect the sale of beedi.

Retail sale of beedi should be allowed and the value added tax imposed on beedi withdrawn, the protestors said.

After taking out the rally from Lourdhunathan statue, the processionists reached Jawahar Grounds in Palayamkottai, where they organised a meeting to highlight their demands.

Vans carrying the names of beedi companies brought beedi workers from far off places of the district to Palayamkottai for this rally.
title: Beedi workers take out rally
